Description: Fragment of a circular glazed composition inlay element, reconstructed from four pieces, with cluster of green reeds against an off-white background. Detailing and outline of reeds in darker brown.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, The North Suburb, South Central Quarter, House U.36.20. (?)
Curator's comments: Published: Frankfort and Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten II (London 1933), 17 & 18, pl. XXX, fig.1.

Colourful faience inlays were a feature of house, temple and palace decoration at Tell el-Amarna. See, for example: Fairman, City of Akhenaten II (London, 1933): pl.30 Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten III (London, 1951): pls.62, 72 Pharaohs of the Sun (exhibition catalogue, Boston, 1999): 228
Exhibition history: 2012 7 December - 13 April 2013, Berlin, Neues Museum, In the Light of Amarna
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 29/10 (Egypt Exploration Society excavation number)
Excavation/small finds number: 29/11 (Egypt Exploration Society excavation number)
Excavation/small finds number: 29/79 (Egypt Exploration Society excavation number)
